message.content:
cs.IR, cs.DL, cs.HC, cs.CL, cs.CY 

The paper discusses the methods scholars use to discover relevant literature and how online scholarly information systems are changing this process. It specifically mentions the use of recommender systems, which are commonly used in information retrieval (IR) and digital libraries (DL) research (cs.IR, cs.DL). The paper also discusses the cognitive abilities of the human user, which suggests a focus on human-computer interaction (HCI) research (cs.HC). Additionally, the paper mentions browsing journals and abstract books, which are common in natural language processing (NLP) and computational linguistics (CL) research (cs.CL). Finally, the paper discusses the increasing rate of scholarly literature production, which could be relevant to research in complex systems (cs.CY).
